Lee Hae In

Korean: 이해인

I.B.I

Introduction

Lee Hae In is a South Korean singer-songwriter, actress, and creative director signed under DOD.

She was first known for participating in the first seasons of MNET's hit survival show Produce 101, where she was eliminated in the final episode after ranking 17th place. At that time, she was a trainee under SS Entertainment.

Due to her participation in the survival show, Lee Hae In was able to be a part of I.B.I, a five-member project girl group formed of some of the popular contestants. She made her debut with the group on August 16, 2016, with the release of their first and only single titled "Molae Molae". The group ended up disbanding sometimes between November and December 2016.

Later that year, Lee Hae In made her acting debut with a supporting role in the drama 'Something About 1 Percent'. Since then, she also played support role in dramas such as 'My Secret Romance' in 2017 and 'Tutorial' in 2022.

In 2017, she was a contestant in MNET' survival show Idol School, where she was again eliminated in the final after ranking 11th place this time.

Sometimes in 2020, she joined The Groove Company (who later merged with Big Ocean ENM), under which she made her solo debut on November 17, 2020, with the release of her first song called “Santa Lullaby (We Used To Sing)”.

On June 2, 2022, Lee Hae In revealed her involvement in some of S2 Entertainment and AURA's production and, on May 11, 2023, that she was working as a creative director for the girl group KISS OF LIFE.

More recently, she became a judge, and more precisely the creative director, for JTBC' survival show PROJECT7, which aired from October 18 to December 27, 2024.

On December 20, 2024, it was reported that she had signed a contract with DOD.

In January 2025, it was announced that Lee Hae In had stepped down of her role as a creative director for KISS OF LIFE since November 2024. Still in January, she was said to be the creative director for PROJECT7's upcoming boy group, CLOSE YOUR EYES.
